name.value: Nictiz MedMij BgZ - PHR Client - Scenario 1.1 - Retrieve BgZ - XML

description.value: MedMij BgZ for FHIR STU3 (v3.0.1) - Scenario 1.1: Retrieve BgZ - XML Format - All BgZ resources of person 1. Response consists of 55 resources.

Test PHR Client retrieve search operation for known Patient resource of person 1 including the patient's general practitioner. The expected response code is 200(OK) and content is a searchset Bundle resource with 1 Patient resource entry and 1 Practitioner resource entry, returned in XML format.
PHR Server retrieve search operation for known Patient, including the reference practitioner resource.
Confirm that the client requested an Accept of the FHIR XML mime type 'application/fhir+xml'.
Confirm that the client did not request a Content-Type. Warning only to allow for systems that automatically send Content-Type.
Confirm that HTTP header Authorization contains the patient token {$patient-token-id}
Confirm that the Observation query parameter 'patient=' was not present to avoid BSNs in the URL.
Confirm that the Observation query parameter 'subject=' was not present to avoid BSNs in the URL.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains the FHIR mime-type 'application/fhir+xml'.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Bundle.
Confirm that the returned Bundle conforms to the base FHIR specification.
Confirm that the returned Bundle type is searchset.
Confirm that the returned Bundle total value matches or is less than the number of entries in the Bundle. The included resources should not be counted as entries in the .total.
Confirm that the returned searchset Bundle contains 2 entries.
